understanding how the scene is changing so we released Amazon recognition video
to really help our customers solve that problem understanding what's inside of a
our set of moving images so within Amazon recognition video some of the feature set that we saw with recognition
image is similar picking up what are the objects who are the people what is the
you know looking for inappropriate content looking for celebrities so those are all similar features but it's also
got a new feature and something that doesn't exist in any other video machine
vision sort of product and it's something called person tracking now a person tracking solves a problem that
was really hard with with being able to analyze video before let's say you've got three people who are in a frame and
and they're walking together and one of them walks out of the frame or they walk behind an object other systems might say
I no longer see that person they're not in the picture but actually they are right there just out there not able to
identify them in that moment or you're not able to see them but they're still in the the frame so what we have with
person tracking is the ability to use what's called skeleton modelling that says based on who is just there before
and who's now gone missing who do we expect to see again so being able to make a really smart assessment of who's
still in the picture even if they're obscured or if their face is turned or if they've gone out of just out of frame
and then come back in so again solving this problem that before was really hard for our customers to solve on their own
